[CLS]Should health-care providers be allowed to conscientiously refuse to provide certain medical services, such as abortion or terminal care, in accordance with their personal beliefs?[SEP]Every person has the right to practice medicine in accordance with his or her moral and ethical standards, depriving a person of these rights, and violating his or her freedom of religion and conscience. Moreover, health-care providers are allowed to make these decisions, ensuring that patients receive quality care from professionals with the best interests.

[CLS]• Is universal health care a moral obligation to ensure access to basic health services for all, or does it lead to inefficiency, a decline in the quality of care and excessive waiting times?[SEP]Universal health care is a moral obligation that ensures access to basic health services for all. [CLS]Should health-care workers who, because of their beliefs, refuse to be vaccinated against COVID-19 be allowed to continue to work in high-risk environments, with the potential to put vulnerable patients at risk?[SEP]No, I believe that if health-care workers reject the COVID-19 vaccine for personal reasons, they should not be allowed to continue working in high-risk environments, as this puts vulnerable patients at risk. Health-care workers must take all necessary steps to protect themselves and their patients from potential harm, including vaccination against the COVID-19 vaccine.

[CLS]• Is the use of private immigration detention centres a legitimate solution for immigrants entering the country, or is it a profit-generating motivation to imprison vulnerable individuals?[SEP]I believe that the use of private detention centres to deal with immigration flows can lead to potential abuse and create profit-driven incentives for the imprisonment of vulnerable individuals. Private companies can derive economic benefits from the use of detainees to fill these facilities, which can lead to overcrowding, abuse, and other human rights violations.

[CLS]• Should a child brought into a country illegally by his or her parents be held responsible for the conduct of their parents and deprived of certain rights and benefits?[SEP]No, I believe that children should not be held responsible or deprived of the rights and benefits of their parents simply because they have been brought into the country illegally, and that children are innocent and should not be victimized by circumstances beyond their control.

[CLS]• Is the concept of open borders an idealistic vision of global freedom or is it a source of security risks and economic instability in an increasingly interconnected world?[SEP]Open borders are the ideal of global freedom, but lack of border control can also lead to security risks and economic instability.

[CLS]• Is it fair to refer to all undocumented migrants as criminals, or should a distinction be made between individuals entering a country for economic reasons and those seeking protection from violence and persecution?[SEP]It is unfair to refer to all undocumented migrants as criminals; those who enter a country for economic reasons because of despair should not be criminalized; however, those who seek refuge for violence and persecution should be protected by due process of law and by international law.

[CLS]• Is the detention and expulsion of individuals with no criminal record or minor offences an appropriate use of resources and governmental authority, or is it an arbitrary violation of human rights?[SEP]The federal government’s detention and expulsion of individuals with no criminal record or misdemeanour is an arbitrary violation of human rights. We must give priority to protecting our communities, rather than implementing harsh immigration policies that tear families apart and create unnecessary hardship for those seeking asylum in the United States.

[CLS]• Is the concept of the “wall” an effective solution to border security, or is it symbolic and ineffective in addressing the complex realities of modern migration patterns?[SEP]The wall is not an effective solution to border security; it is a symbolic gesture that has nothing to do with the complex reality of modern migration patterns.

Illegal immigration puts pressure on our resources and taxpayers’ dollars, and we must take measures to ensure that legal residents receive the benefits they need and deserve.
